700039f-b.text:
(1)
Eastern Boulevard, at Metcalf Ave. (vantage point, not seen). The view is in a southwesterly direction across the meadows towards the Bronx River. In the background appears a gas tank and the coke plant of the Consolidated Edison Company at Hunt's Point, on the
East River.
July 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
July 30, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
An additional view. In the foreground is Barretto Creek winding
its course through the meadows.
May 31, 1928.
P.L. Sperr.
700039f-b.folder: 134th Street (East) & St. Ann's Avenue, Bronx, NY

700032f-a.text:
East 134th Street, east from (No. 586) but not including St. Anns Ave., showing buildings being razed to make way for the construction of
the approach to the Triborough Bridge.
May 11, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
700032f-a.folder: 134th Street (East) & St. Ann's Avenue, Bronx, NY
